summary: Internal FBI email discussing the transfer of the Epstein investigation case file from the Miami FBI office to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for digitization by a third-party vendor. The email seeks concurrence from the Miami office before releasing the files.

events.title: Request to Transfer Epstein Case File
events.description: FBI email correspondence discussing the transfer of the Epstein investigation case file to SDNY for digitization by a third-party vendor.
personsInvolved: SSA Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI office mobile

keyFacts: The FBI received the Epstein case file from the Miami office (MM) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) requested it be sent to a third-party vendor for digitization.
The email indicates this type of digitization request has been done numerous times in the past with other FBI files.
The FBI Supervisory Special Agent seeks concurrence from the Miami office before releasing the files, as they belong to that office.
The case file is described as large, justifying the digitization for scanning, cataloguing, and indexing purposes.
